name: Pieter Wuille
cooked: Work (defined as the expected number of hashes for an individual block) is an exactly known quantity, not subject to a probability distribution. It’s exactly proportional to difficulty, or inversely proportional to the target. To estimate number-of-hashes-performed, we just need to sum up the work for each block; I believe that is both the maximum likelihood estimate and unbiased. I’ll try to work out the math to make that formal.
